alert.note: Alert for Northern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 4:40PM EST until February 21 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, rain changing to wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one to two inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, wintry mix precipitation expected including snow, sleet and freezing rain. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. Highest ice accumulations are expected in elevations at or above 1500ft. * WHERE...Northern Berkshire County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM EST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates Wednesday evening may reach 0.5 inch to 1 inch per hour at times before transitioning to a wintry mix.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
